screenReaderLabel.description: A label is required for accessibility

size.description: Control the height of the progress bar

valueNow.description: Receives the progress of the event

formatScreenReaderValue.description: A function for formatting the text provided to screen readers via `aria-valuenow`

renderValue.description:
A function to format the displayed value. If null the value will not display.
Takes `valueNow` and `valueMax` as parameters.

color.description: Controls the overall color scheme of the component

meterColor.description:
Control the color of the progress meter. Defaults to showing theme success
color on completion, based on `valueNow` and `valueMax`.

shouldAnimate.description: Whether the change of value should have a transition

margin.description:
Valid values are `0`, `none`, `auto`, `xxx-small`, `xx-small`, `x-small`,
`small`, `medium`, `large`, `x-large`, `xx-large`. Apply these values via
familiar CSS-like shorthand. For example: `margin="small auto large"`.

elementRef.description: Provides a reference to the component's root HTML element

as.description: Set the element type of the component's root

renderValueInside.description:
If true, displays the `renderValue` inside the progress meter for customization.

Note: This should not be used in most cases. When enabled, ensure `renderValue` is styled for proper
legibility and alignment across themes and sizes.

title: ProgressBar
